moves.1. e4: If you don't know, this is an over-the-board game I played in Seattle.
moves.1... c6 2. d4 d5 3. exd5 cxd5 4. Bd3 Nc6: I was out of book and I didn't know what to do.  LOL
moves.10. Nd2 Rc8: I remember this being a common move in this line.
moves.11. Ngf3: aahh... My opponent didn't want to double his pawns on the f-file.  Very obvious once he made the move.
moves.11... Bh5: ?? I wanted to trade White's Bishop-d3 right away.  A bad move now that I review it.
moves.12... Qb6: ?! Again playing a move that I knew was common in this line.
moves.13. O-O Nc6 14. Qa4 e6: It's only now that I think: I should castle right away.
moves.15. Rab1 a6: Protecting the a6-square as I analyzed a lot of potential threats by White and thought a6 would neutralize the threats.
moves.16. Rfc1: ! Boy! White sure develop his pieces.
moves.16... Be7:
oh!  I need to caslte right away.
I thought of this being better than Bishop-d6.
moves.17. Be3: I don't know what he was planning with this move.
moves.17... Ng4:
By this time I had spent over 70 minutes on my clock in a 2 hour game.
My opponent spend about 45 minutes of his clock
moves.18. c4 Nxe3 19. fxe3 f6:
Well, I couldn't castle for obvious reasons and I thought this to be the best way to rid the Knight-e5.
What do you suggest?
moves.20... fxe5:
!? A little crazy,  but in way I believe I am diving into my opponents lion den and I tell him to bring it!
LOL! This is how I play sometimes.
Plus I wanted to Castle.
moves.22. cxb7 Rxc1+ 23. Rxc1 Qxb7: I believed my postion to be okay as I had the Bishop pair.  According to Fritz 9 my postion was losing.
moves.25. Bxh7+ Kh8 26. exd4 Bg5: Hey! I thought I was still in the game.
moves.27. Be4 Qb4 28. Qc5: And my opponent goes in for the Queen swap.
moves.28... Be3+ 29. Kh1 Qxc5: I thought it was best to swap Queens and bank on a draw.
moves.30. Rxc5: But I didn't see my hanging Bishop!
moves.30... Be2 31. Nf3 Bxd4 32. Rc2:
During post analyses, my foe stated that he didn't see any way to proceed the game; as he saw Rook-h5+ but didn't know see anthing good afterwards.
What do you see?
moves.32... Bxf3:
Creating an engame with opposites colored Bishops.
I had 18-minutes left.
he had 36-minutes.
moves.33... Rb8 34. b3 Kg8 35. Rc6 Rb6 36. Rxb: Both of us received an additional hour.
moves.41. f4 Bd6 42. Kf3 Ba3 43. Ke2 Bc1 44. K: I thought it to be better to head to the other side.
